content: Technology school at National University of SingaporeThis article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Institute of Systems Science" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(December 2017)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)*‹ The template *Infobox university* is being considered for merging. › The **Institute of Systems Science** (abbreviated as **NUS-ISS**) is a technology school at the [National University of Singapore](/wiki/National_University_of_Singapore). It was established in 1981. The school offers programmes including Master of Technology and [Graduate Diploma](/wiki/Graduate_diploma) in Systems Analysis. ## History In 1981, the institution was established and began offering a Graduate Diploma in Systems Analysis. That same year, it initiated senior executive seminars and IT project management training, collaborating with IBM for four years. By 1984, the institute had relocated to its premises at 21 Heng Mui Keng Terrace. It expanded into large-scale R&D in 1985. Two years later, in 1987, it worked with the National Computer Board and the Singapore Economic Development Board on the Small Enterprise Computerisation Programme, aimed at SMEs. - [National University of Singapore](/wiki/National_University_of_Singapore) - [Technology education](/wiki/Technology_education)
title: Institute of Systems Science
